title: Real Estate Investment Calculator
subtitle: Calculate your property investment returns with detailed financial analysis

tooltips.afaRate: Annual depreciation rate for tax purposes. Standard: 2% (50 years), Old buildings (pre-1925): 2.5%, New buildings (post-2023): 3%
tooltips.specialAmortization: Additional accelerated depreciation for energy efficiency or government programs
tooltips.marginalTaxRate: Your highest tax bracket rate for calculating tax benefits
tooltips.purchasePrice: Total purchase price of the property including all acquisition costs
tooltips.area: Living area of the property in square meters
tooltips.region: Select the Berlin district where the property is located. Different districts may have varying market conditions
tooltips.energyEfficiency: Energy efficiency class from A+ (most efficient) to H (least efficient). Better efficiency may qualify for special financing
tooltips.additionalExpenses: Monthly owner expenses such as property management, maintenance reserves, insurance, etc.
tooltips.loanAmount: Principal amount of the main bank loan. Should not exceed 80-90% of purchase price
tooltips.interestRate: Annual interest rate for the main loan. Current market rates vary between 3-5%
tooltips.repaymentRate: Annual repayment rate. Higher rates mean faster loan payoff but higher monthly payments
tooltips.loanTerm: Duration of the loan in years. Typical terms are 20-30 years
tooltips.hasKfwLoan: KfW offers subsidized loans for energy-efficient properties and renovations with favorable terms
tooltips.kfwLoanAmount: Amount of the KfW subsidized loan. This is in addition to your main bank loan
tooltips.kfwInterestRate: KfW interest rate is typically lower than market rates, often 1-3%
tooltips.kfwRepaymentRate: KfW repayment rate, often with initial repayment-free years
tooltips.kfwLoanTerm: KfW loan term, typically 10-30 years depending on the program
tooltips.specialAmortizationYears: Number of years you can claim special amortization. Usually limited to first few years
tooltips.rentGrowthRate: Expected annual increase in rental income. Historical average in Germany is 2-3%
tooltips.propertyGrowthRate: Expected annual property value appreciation. Long-term average in German cities is 2-4%
